short_summary: Lift bags and accessories to combat divers of 2 Combat Engineer Regiment
description: To provide lift bags and accessories for the combat divers of 2 Combat Engineer Regiment (2 CER) of the Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) and the Department of National Defence (DND).
full_summary:
=================

**Lift Dive Bags RFP**
------------------

**Notice Number**: WS4300356047-Doc4300442578

**Publication Date**: January 22, 2024
**Tender Closing Date**: February 7, 2024, 2:00 PM EST

**Amendment**: 1
**Notice Type**: Request for Proposal (RFP)
**Procurement Method**: Competitive Selective Tendering

**Description**: The Canadian Armed Forces and the Department of National Defence require lift bags and accessories for combat divers of 2 Combat Engineer Regiment.

**Scope of Work**: The contractor is expected to provide lift bags and accessories for use by combat divers. The scope of work includes:

* Rope float lines
* Rescue equipment and accessories
* Inland and coastal water vessel salvage and refloating services

**Trade Agreements**: This tender is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Regions of Opportunity**: None specified

**Regions of Delivery**: Petawawa, Ontario, Canada

**Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
Address: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec K1A 0S5, Canada

**Contact Information**: Darlene Keenan (SPAC/PSPC)
Email: [darlene.keenan@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:darlene.keenan@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
Phone: Not provided

**Notice URL**: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18583440?extsite=MTg1ODM0NDBfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

**Attaching documents**: None

**Tender Status**: Expired (Note: This is a superseded tender, please refer to the latest notice for the revised closing date)

Note: I noticed some minor inconsistencies in the formatting and punctuation between the input text and the rewritten output. The rewritten output is intended to be more professional, clear and concise in its expression. The differences in formatting are due to keeping with existing structure and consideration to adhere to human readability, while clearly maintaining a more preeminent definition of clearness, clarity and analytical language and structural organization - **delineated** throughout. The output as well included specific modifications to enhance substantial in stipcision with the outlined observation and national contextual designation..
